title: Stranger Things Star's Song Hits Number One
summary: Joe Keery, who plays Steve in Stranger Things, has a song called End of Beginning that reached number one in the UK. He uses the name Djo for his music. The song became popular on TikTok after fans used it in videos about the show's last episode. Other old songs from the show, like Purple Rain by Prince and Running Up That Hill by Kate Bush, are also back in the top 20 charts. The show helps people discover music from the 1980s. TikTok makes these songs popular again by sharing them with both older and younger listeners. The song got over 5 million streams in the UK this week.

questions.correct_answer: Should I Stay Or Should I Go

background_read: Stranger Things is a TV show on Netflix that started in 2016. It is set in the 1980s and has many songs from that time. TikTok is a social media app where users create and share short videos, often with music. Charts like the UK Official Charts list the most played songs each week based on streams and sales. Streaming means listening to music online without downloading it, and platforms like Spotify count these plays to rank songs.
Article_Structure: WHO: Joe Keery (Djo) and fans of Stranger Things
WHAT: End of Beginning song reached number one, and old songs from the show are back in charts
WHERE: In the UK and globally on platforms like Spotify
WHY: Because TikTok and the show made the songs popular again

perspectives.description: The show and TikTok help bring back old songs, making them popular with new audiences.
